pageContext.claim: “The average Montana family of four will take home $2,281 extra this year, and many will take home much more than that.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump cites a statistic circulated by congressional Republicans, focusing on a family of four, but the Montana Department of Revenue said the average tax cut would be $1,618 in 2018, with big differences in income levels. For the top third of income earners, those making more than $64,000, the average cut will be $3,881. It will be $945 for a household earning between $64,000 and $200,000, and $307 for those making less.
